Question
========

In a survey with a random sample of 56 people, people were asked whether people agreed with the judge's ruling in the case of Wilders. In that case, the judge ruled that his film did not incite hatred or violence against Muslims. The percentage of people who agreed with the judge's ruling was 80%. The researchers wanted know if the percentage in the population was greater than 75%. To that end the researchers set up a null hypothesis stating that the percentage of people who agree with the judge is 75%. The P-value under this test is

Answerlist
----------

* 0.1938
* 0.1964
* 0.75

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.1938: Correct
* 0.1964: Incorrect
* 0.75: Incorrect
